rationale:
Autonomously detect the presence
of high solar irradiation and get
away if possible, by using chemical
propulsion.
fulltext: Whenever solar_irradiation >Normal_solar_radiation BepiColmbo shall immediately satisfy get_away_chemically

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (solar_irradiation > Normal_solar_radiation) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale:
Once ground signal has been reac-
quired, Astrobee resumes down-
linking the live video stream to the
Control Station.
fulltext: Whenever ISSConnection & Groundsignal & !Stream Astrobee shall until Stream satisfy downlink

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (ISSConnection & Groundsignal & ! Stream) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must remain true until (but not necessarily including) the point where the stop condition holds, or to the end of the interval. If the stop condition never occurs, RES must hold until the end of the scope, or forever. If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is satisfied.

semantics.pctlExpanded: P>=1[(G (((ISSConnection & Groundsignal) & (! Stream)) => (P>=1[((Stream R (downlink | Stream)) | (false R downlink))])))]

rationale:
Only once the rover is safely on
the martian surface will flight soft-
ware command the preparation and
downlink of EDL Camera images
and microphone data.
fulltext: Upon SafeLanding EDL shall at the next timepoint satisfy Preparation & DownLink

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: first point in the interval if (SafeLanding) is true and any point in the interval where (SafeLanding) becomes true (from false). REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at the next time step.

rationale:
Pressing the Transfer Switch shall
always change the pilot flying side.
fulltext: Upon TransferSwitch FGS shall immediately satisfy SwitchSides

rationale:
Automated change detection and
trending. Once a baseline sensor
map is available, changes at the
next update can indicate developing
problems at an early stage
fulltext: Whenever SurveyDone Astrobee shall eventually satisfy CompareMaps

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (SurveyDone) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

rationale:
On the other hand, during the higher
speeds of the en-route phase, the
wings provide lift, the rear propeller
provides thrust, and the lifting ro-
tors are inactive (wing-borne mode,
WB)
fulltext: In EnRoute LPC shall always satisfy !LiftingRotors & ThrustRearPropeller & WingsLift

rationale:
Autonomously maintain the on-
board equipment and the space-
craft structure in proper temperature
range.

REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at all time points between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

rationale:
Astrobee is programmed to stop
when it detects an obstacle
fulltext: Upon ObstacleDetected Astrobee shall immediately satisfy Stop

REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale:
In a SLM survey, crew takes mea-
surements at locations described in
procedures, attempting to take the
measurement as close to the de-
scribed point as possible

TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

rationale:
The algorithm first selects the
vernier jet or the group of pri-
mary jets whose acceleration has
the largest scalar (dot) product with
the desired rotational acceleration
vector.
fulltext: SRC shall at the next timepoint satisfy (SelectFirstJet | SelectPrimaryJets) & !(SelectFirstJet & SelectPrimaryJets)

TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at the next time step.

rationale:
Localizing problems. For example,
if a leak produces a whistling sound,
acoustic or ultrasonic sensors on-
board the robot can be used to pin-
point its location.
fulltext: Whenever AnomalyDetected Astrobee shall eventually satisfy PinpointProblem

rationale:
During the Destructive re-entry
a mode of operation in use is
STANDBY which should both be
done when the IM is in a deployed
configuration

rationale:
If second and third jets are required,
they are similarly selected on the
basis of the second and third largest
scalar products.
fulltext: Whenever SecondJet | ThirdJet SRC shall immediately satisfy SelectNeededJet

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (SecondJet | ThirdJet) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale:
we are considering using Astrobees
lights and/or speaker to signal when
it enters a hatchway
fulltext: Whenever EntersHatchway Astrobee shall immediately satisfy EntranceAlarm

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (EntersHatchway) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale:
Safe mode: In IM safe mode all
components are activated at limited
level (adopted in case of contin-
gency)
fulltext: In SAFEMODE IM shall always satisfy components_limited_level

rationale:
This type of data could be supple-
mented with denser, though shorter
duration, measurements from a mo-
bile platform. The Radiation En-
vironment Monitor (REM) hard-
ware developed at the University of
Houston and NASA Johnson Space
Center is an example of the sort of
small, light-weight sensor that As-
trobee could carry to create higher
resolution maps of the ISS environ-
ment.
fulltext: Astrobee shall eventually satisfy RadiationLocation & RadiationSurvey

semantics.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

rationale:
The system shall not change the pi-
lot flying side unless the Transfer
Switch is pressed.
fulltext: FGS shall until switch satisfy !SwitchSides

semantics.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must remain true until (but not necessarily including) the point where the stop condition holds, or to the end of the interval. If the stop condition never occurs, RES must hold until the end of the scope, or forever.  If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is satisfied.

burn out.

rationale:

rationale:
The system shall not change the pi-
lot flying side unless the Transfer
Switch is pressed.

TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

rationale:
The SPHERES satellites, however,
triangulate their position using in-
frared/ultrasonic beacons, prevent-
ing them from navigating outside
the two-meter cube defined by the
fixed beacon locations.

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (moving) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale:
However, if the vSLAM output re-
mains unavailable for an extended
period, the robot rotates in place un-
til the feature points detected in the
current view align with those in the
stored map

rationale:
When mating is complete, perma-
nent magnets on the berth attract
striker plates on the robot, provid-
ing a passive retention force

ers the approach and capture by the
robotic arm

rationale:
The probability that the aircraft
turns more than a prescribed degree
(|he|  35) shall be extremely low

TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

The Control Station prevents oper-

late through a KOZ to Astrobee un-
til the violating segments are modi-
fied

After a sortie, Astrobee transfers
large files through a hard-wired Eth-
ernet connection with its dock

rationale:

fied

TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

powers down its propulsion system.

Control Station displays the posi-

the operators are aware of the other
activities and can avoid collisions.

automatically detects that the re-
maining battery power is low, it re-
turns to the DS for recharging

in charge of providing the ground

be able to automatically collect
telemetry data.

semantics.diagramVariables: CC = (! ISSConnection & ! Groundsignal), SC = (ISSConnection & Groundsignal), Response = (reconnect).
semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (! ISSConnection & ! Groundsignal) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must remain true until (but not necessarily including) the point where the stop condition holds, or to the end of the interval. If the stop condition never occurs, RES must hold until the end of the scope, or forever. If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is satisfied.

rationale:
In case of presence of high solar ir-
radiation the system will be able to
shield the electronics
fulltext: Whenever solar_irradiation >Normal_solar_radiation BepiColmbo shall immediately satisfy shield_electronics

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (solar_irradiation > Normal_solar_radiation) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale:
LVS begins taking pictures at 4.2
km altitude and matching them up
to an onboard map.
fulltext: Whenever Altitude <= 4.2 LVS shall immediately satisfy TakePictures & Match

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (Altitude <= 4.2) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale:
At most one side shall be the pilot
flying side.
fulltext: FGS shall always satisfy PilotFlying >= 1

semantics.description:
ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at all time points between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

rationale:
The robot can periodically update
multi-sensor 3D maps of the vehi-
cle. Thermal imaging tracking can
all help flight controllers understand
system status
fulltext: Whenever TimeForThermalImaging Astrobee shall eventually satisfy ThermalImagingSurvey

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: every point in the interval where (TimeForThermalImaging) is true. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at some time point between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

rationale:
Once the variances of the deriva-
tives of acceleration and angular ve-
locity from the IMU exceed pre-
defined upper thresholds, the status
shifts to collision mode.
fulltext: If (VelocityVariancesc >UpperVelocityThreshold) & (AccelerationVariances >UpperAccelerationThreshold) IntBall2 shall immediately satisfy CollisionMode

REQUIRES: for every trigger, if trigger holds then RES also holds at the same time point.

rationale:
During the On orbit tests and ops
Phase the only modes of operation
in use is CHECK, SAFE, NOM-
INAL TESTING and NOMINAL
CREW mode which should be done
when the IM is in a deployed con-
figuration

rationale:
during takeoff and landing, the air-
craft motion is controlled by the lift-
ing rotors only
fulltext: In LandingMode LPC shall always satisfy LiftingRotors & !FlightSurfaces

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in every interval where LandingMode holds. TRIGGER: first point in the interval. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at all time points between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.
